required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Observational Study of Dry Eye Prior to Laser-Assisted in Situ Keratomileusis (LASIK) Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: This is an observational, study of dry eye in patients at the consultation visit prior to LASIK surgery. There is no treatment administered or intervention during the study.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients in Each Category of the Dry Eye Workshop Severity (DEWS) Scale
primary_outcome.description: The severity of each patient's dry eye was classified by the physician according to the DEWS scale. Categories are: mild and/or episodic, occurs under environmental stress; moderate episodic or chronic, stress or no stress; and severe frequent or constant without stress

arm_group.description: Patients attending consultation for LASIK on Day 1. No intervention or treatment is administered during the study.

intervention.description: Patients attending consultation for LASIK on Day 1. No intervention or treatment is administered during the study.

study_pop.textblock: Patients consulting with ophthalmologist for possible LASIK

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Attending an ophthalmology consultation for LASIK
Exclusion Criteria:
- None

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
